page.title: 19Rural Interests - Calbourne
page.content: There are a number of farming interests which involve smallholdings: A variety of{Rare Breeds}are kept on the parkland surrounding Westover House. These include White Park cattle and Soay Sheep. There are two herds of{Goats.} A herd of Anglo-Nubians is kept at The Old Rectory to provide milk for{Cheese {Making}as well as domestic use. The cheese is sold both on the Island and in London. The other herd, of Toggenburgs, is kept at Beechcroft, Lodge Farm to provide{Milk}for sale. A number of hives of{Bees}are to be found in the area. The resulting {Honey}is harvested in late summer. The above enterprises do not provide the main income of the farmers concerned and are usually run on a part-time basis.
